intro: Vickifunkia karataviensis, commonly known as the Karatavi bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
